events.message: The insured submitted a claim reporting a collision involving their car and a tree on a residential street.
Claim has been categorized as an auto accident based on keywords detected in the initial report and documentation.
An agent specialized in auto claims was assigned promptly to handle the case and begin communication with the insured.
The insured was sent confirmation acknowledging receipt of the claim and outlining the next procedural steps.
Requested accident photos, police report, and vehicle repair estimates from the policyholder to support claim processing.
The insured promptly submitted all requested documentation, including detailed repair quotes and official police report.
The investigation team began reviewing submitted documents and conducting interviews to assess the accident circumstances.
Investigation concluded confirming the policyholder was not at fault, with clear evidence substantiating the claim.
A settlement offer was proposed covering full repair costs based on estimates and investigation results.
The insured expressed satisfaction with the timely communication and fairness of the settlement offer.
The claim was officially approved following acceptance of the settlement terms by the insured party.
Payment was issued to cover vehicle repairs and any additional expenses as outlined in the settlement.
The claim was formally closed after payment issuance and confirmation with the insured that all matters were resolved.
The claim file was archived in compliance with company record-keeping policies for future reference if needed.
